original_text:
Book of Muertos
Una festa colorata
El dia de los Muertos è la festa che si celebra in Messico e più in generale nei paesi del Sud America per commemorare i defunti. Ricca di folclore, questa ricorrenza si svolge tra il ventotto ottobre e il primo novembre e prevede l’utilizzo di carri allegorici, teschi, rose e ghirlande.
Con questa slot la Spinomenal è riuscita a ricreare la giusta atmosfera che si respira nelle vie di Città del Messico, anche in virtù di una grafica semplice ma d’impatto. Sullo sfondo si nota un tipico paese sudamericano, ma di notte, con qualche luce e petali di rosa che cadono dall’alto. E proprio le rose sono uno degli elementi che caratterizzano tutti i simboli, da quelli di basso livello come le carte da gioco, a quelli maggiormente remunerativi, come il teschio e la donna mascherata.
Linee di pagamento fisse e una griglia grande
Di solito siamo abituati a vedere griglie 5×3, in questo caso però la Spinomenal ha mantenuto le 3 linee ma optato per un rullo aggiuntivo, quindi 6. Le linee di pagamento sono 10 e fisse, con il costo della singola partita fissato a 0,10 €.
Tra le funzioni presenti, troviamo l’Autoplay, anche se a differenza di altri giochi, qua non è possibile decidere a monte il numero di giri automatici.
La volatilità è media, mentre il ritorno teorico al giocatore è pari al 96,01%.
Una funzione speciale che può anche essere acquistata
In Book of Muertos troviamo simboli regolare di basso e medio livello e uno speciale che invece regala vincite molto alte.
I simboli di minor valore sono le carte da gioco dal dieci all’asso, quelli di medio valore invece sono il cappello, le pistole incrociate, il teschio e la donna.
A pagare più di tutti è però il simbolo Wild, rappresentato dal libro dei morti. Con 3 di questi simboli avremo un moltiplicatore 2x, con 4 simboli sarà x25, con 5 simboli x250 e con 6 ben x500!
Naturalmente il simbolo Wild ricopre anche la funzione classica di Jolly, andando a sostituire tutti i simboli. Inoltre, ha anche al funziona di Scatter e regala dieci Free Spins, durante i quali un simbolo causale verrà scelto e ogni volta che comparirà si espanderà su tutto il rullo. Questo Bonus può anche essere acquistato.
 

Domande Frequenti 
A quanto corrisponde il valore RTP?

In Book of Muertos il ritorno teorico al giocatore è del 96,01%, un return to player di tutto rispetto e pienamente nella media.



Posso giocare a questa slot anche sul tablet?

Certo, esiste una versione per pc e una per dispositivi mobili, per continuare a far girare i rulli ovunque ti trovi e senza perdere in fluidità.



In Book of Muertos quale è la volatilità?

La volatilità è media, ciò significa che non dovrete faticare tantissimo per ottenere delle vincite ma che i premi particolarmente sostanziosi non saranno così frequenti.

raw_translation.response:
Book of Muertos
A colorful celebration
The Day of the Dead is the festival celebrated in Mexico and other South American countries to commemorate the deceased. Rich in folklore, this celebration takes place between October 28th and November 1st and involves the use of allegorical floats, skulls, roses, and wreaths.
With this slot, Spinomenal has managed to recreate the right atmosphere that is breathed in the streets of Mexico City, thanks in part to a simple yet impactful graphics. In the background, you can see a typical South American village, but at night, with some lights and rose petals falling from above. And it is precisely the roses that characterize all the symbols, from low-level ones like playing cards to more remunerative ones like the skull and the masked woman.
Fixed paylines and a large grid
Usually, we are used to seeing grids of 5×3, but in this case, Spinomenal has kept the 3 lines but opted for an additional reel, so 6. Paylines are 10 and fixed, with the cost of a single game set at €0.10.
Among the functions present, we find Autoplay, although unlike other games, here it is not possible to decide the number of automatic spins in advance.
The volatility is medium, while the theoretical return to player is 96.01%.
A special feature that can also be purchased
In Book of Muertos, we find regular low and medium value symbols and a special one that instead gives very high winnings.
The symbols of lower value are the playing cards from ten to ace, while those of medium value are the hat, the crossed guns, the skull, and the woman.
The Wild symbol, represented by the book of the dead, pays more than all the others. With 3 of these symbols, we will have a 2x multiplier, with 4 symbols, it will be x25, with 5 symbols x250, and with 6, an impressive x500!
Of course, the Wild symbol also covers the classic function of the Wild, replacing all the symbols. Moreover, it also has the function of Scatter and gives ten Free Spins, during which a random symbol will be chosen and each time it appears, it will expand to the entire reel. This Bonus can also be purchased.

FAQs
What is the RTP value in Book of Muertos?
In Book of Muertos, the theoretical return to player is 96.01%, a respectable return to player and fully within average.

Can I play this slot on a tablet?
Of course, there is a version for PC and one for mobile devices, to continue spinning the reels wherever you are and without losing fluidity.

What is the volatility in Book of Muertos?
The volatility is medium, which means that you won't have to work too hard to get winnings, but particularly substantial prizes won't be so frequent.

Book of Muertos
A colorful celebration
El dia de los Muertos is a festival celebrated in Mexico and other South American countries to commemorate the dead. Full of folklore, this event takes place between October 28 and November 1 and involves the use of floats, skulls, roses, and garlands.

With this slot, Spinomenal has managed to recreate the right atmosphere that can be felt in the streets of Mexico City, thanks to a simple but impactful graphic design. In the background, you can see a typical South American village at night, with some lights and rose petals falling from above. And it is precisely roses that characterize all symbols, from low-level ones like playing cards to more lucrative ones like the skull and the masked woman.

Fixed paylines and a large grid
We are used to seeing 5x3 grids, but in this case, Spinomenal kept the 3 lines and opted for an additional reel, making it 6. There are 10 fixed paylines, with the cost of a single game set at €0.10.

Among the available functions, we find the Autoplay, although unlike other games, it is not possible to decide in advance the number of automatic spins. The volatility is medium, while the theoretical return to player is 96.01%.

A special function that can also be purchased
In Book of Muertos, we find regular symbols of low and medium value and a special one that instead gives very high payouts. The lower-value symbols are the playing cards from ten to ace, while the medium-value ones are the hat, the crossed guns, the skull, and the woman.

However, the symbol that pays the most is the Wild symbol, represented by the book of the dead. With 3 of these symbols, we will have a 2x multiplier, with 4 symbols, it will be x25, with 5 symbols x250, and with 6 symbols an impressive x500!

Of course, the Wild symbol also covers the classic function of the Joker, replacing all symbols. In addition, it also functions as a Scatter and awards ten Free Spins, during which a random symbol will be chosen, and every time it appears, it will expand across the entire reel. message.content:
Book of Muertos
A colorful celebration
El dia de los Muertos is a festival celebrated in Mexico and other South American countries to commemorate the dead. Full of folklore, this event takes place between October 28 and November 1 and involves the use of floats, skulls, roses, and garlands.

With this slot, Spinomenal has managed to recreate the right atmosphere that can be felt in the streets of Mexico City, thanks to a simple but impactful graphic design. In the background, you can see a typical South American village at night, with some lights and rose petals falling from above. And it is precisely roses that characterize all symbols, from low-level ones like playing cards to more lucrative ones like the skull and the masked woman.

Fixed paylines and a large grid
We are used to seeing 5x3 grids, but in this case, Spinomenal kept the 3 lines and opted for an additional reel, making it 6. There are 10 fixed paylines, with the cost of a single game set at €0.10.

Among the available functions, we find the Autoplay, although unlike other games, it is not possible to decide in advance the number of automatic spins. The volatility is medium, while the theoretical return to player is 96.01%.

A special function that can also be purchased
In Book of Muertos, we find regular symbols of low and medium value and a special one that instead gives very high payouts. The lower-value symbols are the playing cards from ten to ace, while the medium-value ones are the hat, the crossed guns, the skull, and the woman.

However, the symbol that pays the most is the Wild symbol, represented by the book of the dead. With 3 of these symbols, we will have a 2x multiplier, with 4 symbols, it will be x25, with 5 symbols x250, and with 6 symbols an impressive x500!

Of course, the Wild symbol also covers the classic function of the Joker, replacing all symbols. In addition, it also functions as a Scatter and awards ten Free Spins, during which a random symbol will be chosen, and every time it appears, it will expand across the entire reel. This Bonus can also be purchased.

FAQ
What is the RTP value?

In Book of Muertos, the theoretical return to the player is 96.01%, a respectable return to player and fully average.

Can I play this slot on a tablet?

Of course, there is a version for PC and a mobile version to keep spinning the reels wherever you are and without losing fluidity.

What is the volatility in Book of Muertos?

The volatility is medium, which means that you won't have to work too hard to get payouts, but the particularly substantial prizes will not be so frequent.

response.headline: Graphics and design that evoke the Day of the Dead
response.content: Book of Muertos is a slot game that masterfully recreates the atmosphere of the Day of the Dead festival. Spinomenal's graphics are simple yet impactful, with the use of roses to characterize all the symbols and a background that displays a typical South American village at night with rose petals falling from above. The result is a colorful and celebratory game.

response.headline: A 6-reel grid with fixed paylines and a low game cost
response.content: Book of Muertos features a 6-reel grid with 10 fixed paylines, making for a larger playing area than the standard 5x3 grid. Players can make a single bet of €0.10 per game. Additionally, the game includes an Autoplay feature, although unlike some other slots, players are not able to set a specific number of automatic spins in advance.

response.headline: Medium volatility and 96.01% theoretical return to player
response.content: With medium volatility and a theoretical return to player of 96.01%, Book of Muertos offers the chance for steady winnings without making players work too hard. The RTP value is fully within average for online slot games, while the medium volatility means that large prizes may not be as frequent.

response.headline: A Wild symbol that pays high and also functions as a Scatter
response.content: One of the standout symbols in Book of Muertos is the Wild symbol, represented by the book of the dead. This symbol not only substitutes for other symbols, but it also acts as a Scatter, providing ten Free Spins. If three Wild symbols are matched, a 2x multiplier is awarded, while six Wild symbols will award an impressive x500 payout.

response.headline: Free Spins with an expanded symbol feature
response.content: During the Free Spins feature, a random symbol will be chosen, and each time it appears, it will expand to fill the entire reel. This can be a particularly lucrative feature for players who are lucky enough to receive a high-value symbol. It should be noted that this Bonus feature can also be purchased.

Review: Book of Muertos
A colorful celebration
The Day of the Dead is the festival celebrated in Mexico and other South American countries to commemorate the deceased. Rich in folklore, this celebration takes place between October 28th and November 1st and involves the use of allegorical floats, skulls, roses, and wreaths.
With this slot, Spinomenal has managed to recreate the right atmosphere that is breathed in the streets of Mexico City, thanks in part to a simple yet impactful graphics. In the background, you can see a typical South American village, but at night, with some lights and rose petals falling from above. And it is precisely the roses that characterize all the symbols, from low-level ones like playing cards to more remunerative ones like the skull and the masked woman.
Fixed paylines and a large grid
Usually, we are used to seeing grids of 5×3, but in this case, Spinomenal has kept the 3 lines but opted for an additional reel, so 6. Paylines are 10 and fixed, with the cost of a single game set at €0.10.
Among the functions present, we find Autoplay, although unlike other games, here it is not possible to decide the number of automatic spins in advance.
The volatility is medium, while the theoretical return to player is 96.01%.
A special feature that can also be purchased

Book of Muertos features a 6-reel grid with 3 rows and 10 fixed paylines. The game is playable for €0.10 per spin. It also has an Autoplay function, although the number of automatic spins cannot be predetermined.

Symbols and Visuals

The game is themed around the Day of the Dead celebration in Mexico and features colorful symbols such as skulls, roses, and wreaths. Symbols with lower values are represented by playing cards (ten to ace), while those with higher values include a man with a gun, a woman with a mask, a skull, and a hat. The Book of the Dead symbol serves as both the Wild and Scatter, and it pays the most - up to x500 of the stake.

Volatility and Return to Player

Book of Muertos has a medium volatility, which means that it doesn't require too much effort to achieve winnings, but bigger payouts are rarer. The theoretical return to player is 96.01%, which is within the average range.

Wild and Scatter Features

The Book of the Dead symbol serves as both the Wild and Scatter. As a Wild, it substitutes for all the other symbols. As a Scatter, it gives ten Free Spins. During the Free Spins, one symbol is randomly chosen to be expanded across the entire reel each time it appears. Three, four, five, or six Book of the Dead symbols will trigger a 2x, 25x, 250x, or 500x multiplier, respectively.

Bonus Feature

The game's bonus feature consists of ten Free Spins, where one symbol is selected to expand on the entire reel each time it appears. Players can also buy this feature.

Review: Book of Muertos
A colorful celebration
The Day of the Dead is the festival celebrated in Mexico and other South American countries to commemorate the deceased. Rich in folklore, this celebration takes place between October 28th and November 1st and involves the use of allegorical floats, skulls, roses, and wreaths.
With this slot, Spinomenal has managed to recreate the right atmosphere that is breathed in the streets of Mexico City, thanks in part to a simple yet impactful graphics. In the background, you can see a typical South American village, but at night, with some lights and rose petals falling from above. And it is precisely the roses that characterize all the symbols, from low-level ones like playing cards to more remunerative ones like the skull and the masked woman.
Fixed paylines and a large grid
Usually, we are used to seeing grids of 5×3, but in this case, Spinomenal has kept the 3 lines but opted for an additional reel, so 6. Paylines are 10 and fixed, with the cost of a single game set at €0.10.
Among the functions present, we find Autoplay, although unlike other games, here it is not possible to decide the number of automatic spins in advance.
The volatility is medium, while the theoretical return to player is 96.01%.
A special feature that can also be purchased
In Book of Muertos, we find regular low and medium value symbols and a special one that instead gives very high winnings.
The symbols of lower value are the playing cards from ten to ace, while those of medium value are the hat, the crossed guns, the skull, and the woman.
The Wild symbol, represented by the book of the dead, pays more than all the others. With 3 of these symbols, we will have a 2x multiplier, with 4 symbols, it will be x25, with 5 symbols x250, and with 6, an impressive x500!
Of course, the Wild symbol also covers the classic function of the Wild, replacing all the symbols. Moreover, it also has the function of Scatter and gives ten Free Spins, during which a random symbol will be chosen and each time it appears, it will expand to the entire reel. This Bonus can also be purchased.

What is the RTP value in Book of Muertos?
In Book of Muertos, the theoretical return to player is 96.01%, a respectable return to player and fully within average.

The volatility is medium, which means that you won't have to work too hard to get winnings, but particularly substantial prizes won't be so frequent.
